etymology.description: 谢(謝) (xiè, "thank") + 谢(謝) (xiè, "thank") = express gratitude; thank you
etymology.interpretation: Repeated use of 谢(謝) (xiè, "thank") intensifies the expression of gratitude, making it a polite and common way to say 'thank you' in Chinese.

examples.chinese: 谢谢你的礼物(謝謝你的禮物)。
他送来了花(他送來了花)，我说谢谢(我說謝謝)。
examples.pinyin: tā sòng láile huā, wǒ shuō xièxie
examples.english: He sent flowers, and I said thank you.

examples.chinese: 我遇到困难时(我遇到困難時)，朋友总会说谢谢(朋友總會說謝謝)。
examples.pinyin: wǒ yù dào kùnnán shí, péngyǒu zǒng huì shuō xièxie
examples.english: When I face difficulties, my friend always says thank you.
